value.0:
-------------------------------
Restrictions
-------------------------------
There are no functions to set voice sets on NPCs. These cannot be customised, and playable races will always have the default voice we made for that race.
Portrait, name, head, wings, tails, skin and hair colour can all be set. Simple appearances (ie: monster models) can be used as well. Sizing by tails is not supported.

-------------------------------
Initialising
-------------------------------
Make a character that looks like the NPC you want to create. A DM obviously has more options to do so. You then use the widget on this creature. The Cast Spell option will change to Self Only, 4 x Day. You will also get an NPC helmet, armour, suit, cloak, and sword if you make a playeable race NPC. Make sure both the widget and the clothing go into the end user's inventory! You can trhow away anything the NPC doesn't need, though, which can be handy if the PC can't carry an extra suit of full plate.

-------------------------------
Use
-------------------------------
Use the widget to spawn your NPC, and once again to despawn it. You can also use the "Disappear" option in the NPCs convo for the latter (saves you a use of the widget). The NPC will dress in a copy of the suit you got if it's a playable race. You can tailor the one in your inventory to taste. Same goes for the helmet, armour, cloak and sword. Monster type NPCs cannot visibly wear suits or helmets, and will therefore not get the clothing. The NPC has a convo that allows you to let it perform action, emotes and speech.
Mind that the NPC is a coward. It will not attack anybody and sneak away if attacked itself.
